review: The Prime Rib French Dip is scrumptious & costs around $13.
Wonderful salad!  We went here for a late week day lunch so the place was empty.  Food and service were great!

I've eaten at Red thRobin before in OH & MN and it was OK.  I had to log in for this beauty.  I like my steaks rare or medium rare but the Red thRobin burgers I ask for well done.  At this location I politely repeated myself to the waiter when I asked for the double burger with teriyaki and pineapple.  The reason is the medium rare burgers and double especially soak the bottom bread in grease when not well done.  And that is exactly what happened, I told the manager who was grateful for the info. but I had the same thing happen a second time so 1 time shame on them but 2nd time shame on me.

My husband and I love that we can have our burgers wrapped in lettuce instead of having a bun. We usually eat at the Merrillville location, but since we saw a movie nearby we decided to eat at this one. Once we told our server we wanted our burgers wrapped in lettuce and wanted a salad instead of fries, she let us know we can also have broccoli or carrots. She is the only server to tell us that so we came back again and we had the same server, who recognized us from the week before which I thought was nice. For those wondering how the burgers are, you can't really mess up a Royal Red Robin burger.

Bottomless fries, bottomless raspberry lemonades and cherry limeades, and large dinner salads make this place worth visiting. The burgers have been hit or miss in our recent experience, which is not good for a burger place. The service is friendly and a bit on the slow side. 3.5 stars.
Cmon its Red Robin this place is great bottomless fries, burgers and great drinks
one of the few places where the food looks exactly like it does in the menus. good service, and bottomless steak fries are amazing!

The good = It's Red Robin.  If you've been here before, you know they have a nice, big menu, the food is better than Applebee's, and their burgers are wonderful.   The bad = For this particular location - at least when it came to pick-up - the service was SUPER slow.  We stopped in the bar to order the food and had a drink while we waited.   Not only did the food take FOREVER to come out, but A) the bar tender managed to disappear for a good 5-7 minutes right when we saw our bags arrive.  Knowing that the food is already going to get a little cold on the drive home, we waited patiently while it chilled behind the bar.  When the bar tender checked the order, they completely forgot the two sides of fries we ordered... another 5-10 mins later, our order is finally complete, we're paid, and we're out the door...  Just took a really long time and the bar tender didn't really seem to care all that much.  She wasn't nasty or anything - and maybe she was just having a bad day.  Either way, wouldn't shy away from the place.

My son and I arrived at the restaurant in a time crunch for supper yesterday.  Tim, the manager, did an awesome job of accommodating our schedule.  Many thanks for a terrific experience. We will be back!
They're pretty good. Can't complain. Service isn't too bad either. I was in a party of 6 on a Friday night and they sat us within 5 minutes of getting there!

My review, reflects the great disappointment that I received, when my so Called  "Colossus" burger was served . It was a Colossus Joke. It got nothing to do with the picture in the Menu, that looks like a double burger.This was a SAGGY looking burger, that reminded me, a Happy meal burger from Mc Donald's . Hello ! This is a $10.49 burger that comes with 12 French Fries ( Yes I did counted) . Bottom line, This burger could be part of a $1 value menu. It is not worth it. Management and Server try to help, cheer me up, but It was too Late. I did not feel like eating anything and I cancelled my Order,  and End up at Burger King .Yes , the Root Beer Float was Excellent.
Should get the fish and chips they're delicious! Staff are super nice but it takes a long bit of time to get your food.  Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.
Liz is a fantastic server! Handled a slight problem in the bill very well. Went from being disappointed in the trip to having a great experience. Will ask for her in the future

My wife and I were driving around Valpo while starving and wanting a good burger. We kept saying we werent ever going back to Red Robin. Well after awhile we gave in ,even though at least the last 3 times we were disappointed, we went back again unfortunately. The staff is always friendly and attentive.  The problem is that the burgers are HORRIBLE ! TOTAL RIPOFF AGAIN.. I got my Burning Love burger and it was soggy and cold . I sent it back to be microwaved also the burger was maybe a quarter inch thick .the fries had so much salt on them they were not edible. My wife's wasn't any better but she didn't complain..we actually never complain we just don't go back..once again we walked out after paying $42 . On the walk through the parking lot I was telling her that was the worst meal I've ever had. .that we would have been more satisfied by going to Wendy's or even White castle..Never again Red Robin ! Typical corporate greed, cutting corners everywhere they can to make that extra profit while cutting quality. The one star I gave them is for the friendly staff.  .

I had a Swiss cheese burger with lettuce and tomato. With fries on the side. The fries were okay though there were a few soggy ones. You do get all you want. The burger is good for a machine formed burger. Service was good and the waitress was pleasant. A good burger but not great, so 3 stars.

We used to be fans of this location, but after three bad visits in a row, we stopped going to this restaurant. The service became progressively worse. Some of the problems were related to kitchen issues, but we didn't feel as though the overall dining experience was worth the money.
Horrible horrible service. We will not be back. Waiter was hurried and rude and took our credit card before bringing the bill.  Dirty tables all over the restaurant.

I ordered the Purple Haze. If you like coconut and pineapple, you will love this drink. Other drinks ordered are the monster Chocolate Shake and Sex on the beach. No complaints in this area.  Wait staff is attentive and cheerful. Restaurant looks very clean and busy enough for a Monday afternoon. Tower of onions rings are delicious. Ordered precisely as we asked, a little crispy. Pretzel bites have beer cheese filling. Though I didn't try them the others seemed to enjoy them. Food ordered Basic Cheeseburger, Blt croissant with fruit salad side instead of fries,  cluck and shrimp, bacon cheeseburger and.  Everything was perfectly cooked. Not a complaint at the table.  Endless fries with the burgers but the burgers are so filling no one asked for 2nd on the fries! Fruit salad was too sweet for my liking but the apple was nice and crisp. Blt turkey croissant was very good and the avacodo slices on it gave it just a little bit more flavor.  Croissant was fresh too. Our family of 6 is very happy with our visit today. Thanks Red Robin!

Food was aweful. Brought out cold appetizers. Burger was greasy and fries were nasty.  Never had Red Robin before and don't ever plan on wasting my money on it again. The commercial should be Red Robin.....ewwwwwwwwww!
Love the choices of switching out burgers for chicken etc. Teriyaki chicken is the best! Good reward program and free birthday burger.

We've only been here a couple times so far (both times were extremely busy) but a good tip- if you want to be seated right away, sit in the bar area. We have both times and received awesome service. The food comes out pretty quick, too. Super friendly staff.

I went with my family of 6 and waited in the corner booth at 2 pm on Saturday.  Hardly anyone was in the place but we still waited 10 minutes to seat us. Then we sat for 15 minutes without even water service.  The waitress knew we were there because she said that she would be right with us and that never came.  I left and before I went I told the manager.  They tried to comp us but I said I would have preferred to eat.  Terrible service.

Walked in at 1PM or so and was surprised they had a wait. We waited  several moments for a hostess to greet us when dhe finally came I expected a Hello and a perfunctory " sorry for the delay " and got neither. Instead was suddenly asked if we were over 21 when I gave a confused nod she said you can go into the bar area . When I said I didn't want to sit in the bar, she asked for our name. Baffled,   I finally prompted her with the question, "oh there's a wait?!?" And she rudely replied as if we should psychicly know , yep.      How hard is it to say"  Hi Welcome to Red Robin!  We've got a full lunch crowd with a wait of x minutes but if you don't want wait please sit at the bar . "
Bottomless fries are VERY slow tonight. If they're going to advertise this, they need to have them ready.  Asked again for more fries.  Finally got one small order.
Great high energy atmosphere and prices. Great burgers. Everyone tried a different one and loved what they had.

Probably the worst experience ever at this location.  Usually we "take out". We put our name in upon arrival, told 10-20 minute wait, ok no problem.  25 minutes later another couple who just came in were seated.  Upon inquiry I found out our name was no longer on the wait list.  The hostess could not explain.  But, we were then seated.  After ordering and what seemed like an eternity, our waitress said our ticket was up 3rd,,,ok. The manger then came out and said their computer system went down and our order was lost. Lost??  Thought we were up soon??  In the past we've had issues with "take out" also,, wrong order, missing food, etc.
Great place for hungry kids. Bottomless root beer floats. Bottomless fries. Bottomless Mac and cheese. All the things most kids love and can't get enough of, except at Red Robin.

The family loves Red Robin and we think the Valpo location is one of the best.  My kids love the relaxed family friendly atmosphere and the food does not disappoint.  Endless sides make the kids happy as they like the extra helpings of fruit or mandarin oranges.  I love the Western BBQ burger and the wife is always happy with the wraps.

This is probably the worst Red Robin I have ever been to. Rude staff, very dirty inside, sticky dirty tables, sticky floor, and the restroom looks like a bar restroom that's how nasty it is. This place has gone downhill big time in the last few years. My recommendation is make the drive to Merrillville Red Robin as this place is way cleaner, friendly staff, and it actually smells good in there. Used to love Valpo one, but not no more.

For a burger place I thought the burger was average at best, no taste just plain. You could go to 10 different dive bars and get a better burger that what they served. Will never go back and  it was saturday night and the place was packed, sorry folks if anybody thinks this place serves  great burgers than they need to get out moore.

This place isn't great and it isn't terrible. Sandwiched between Octave in Chesterton and Burgerhaus in Valpo I don't know how exactly one ends up here but there I was anyhow. Food is passable if pricey. For example my son ordered a 16$ prime rib sandwich and maybe got three ounces of meat. I get that they expect you to fill up on their bottomless fries but still seems like a bit of a heist in this persons opinion.
We normally like Red Robin but tonight it was not good. Server to slow and did not fill drinks, our burgers too way too long to come out, the kitchen sent out burgers that were over cooked.

It is a friday afternoon and there is only two waitresses about. Management needs to get some more people working and stop being cheap. Only reason it is slow is not having enough workers to even out the work load. Shame on you for trying to save money but yet taking honest peoples days away when they get a bad review cause of what the restaurant has done. Be fair to your workers.

I would like to say I could give this a better rating, but honestly I cannot. After attempting 3 separate visits I have to say I will not be returning. We previously found a fly in our salad, the onion rings fall apart and cannot be eaten without them crumbling in my fingers, we were given RAW uncooked burgers, I had to ask for a plate twice while waiting for 15 minutes while the appetizers got cold, and the food in general leaves a lot to be desired. Our waitress was amenable. She served it all with a smile. However, it wasn't worth the money and time. I would move on to somewhere else if you are looking for good food and good service.

The service here is the best part! The food was great, but the service was even better. I was here alone with three children, and they immediately brought fries for the kids while we waited. Our server was Katie, and she was kind, patient, and understanding. She also asked me before refilling the kids' drinks and bringing extra fries. Great food, perfect service!!

I've had multiple problems with this location.  The first time was when we were seated and never acknowledged.  We waited over 10 minutes and no one ever came, so we got up and left.  The manager didn't even care.  This last time was last night. The service was better but it was so dirty in there!  It's the middle of winter with negative temps and the bar was swarming with fruit flies.  When we brought this to the attention of the waitress she said they were aware but couldn't get rid of them!  You get rid of them by cleaning and putting up traps!!  Ridiculous.  It all culminated with me swatting at one of the bugs which resulted in me accidentally knocking over the cheap beer glass which instantly shattered and lacerated my finger.  Spent the rest of the night at Urgent Care.  I don't plan on going back.
